reviews.review_title: Very nourishing and delicate, wonderful smell
reviews.review_text: I used to work in healthcare and the skin of my hands felt at times like it was falling apart until someone gave me a tube of L'Occitane's Shea Butter Hand Cmrea.  It became something I carried in the pockets of my scrubs at all times.  So you can imagine I was thrilled at the idea of testing their body cream, which turned to be just as fragrant, creamy, and nourishing, on top of the familiar silver and blue packaging. I appreciate the recyclable tin and can't help but wonder why there is a plastic refill available, when the tin is made of metal, which can be recycled forever.  I've only used the cream for a handful (ha) of days because the terms of the collaboration indicate I have to post a review within 7 days.  I don't see any change in the texture of my skin but I do feel a big difference; it doesn't feel nearly as tight as it did before I started using this cream.  I do a lot of spot checks throughout the day -- thankfully a little bit of cream goes a long way!  And I love the smell -- I can smell the jasmine and it's, for me, heavenly, as I love the smell of jasmine.  I'm not sure if both the hand cream and the body cream are always needed; this cream seems to be doing wonders on my hands.  So if you're thinking of trying both the body and hand cream, consider starting with the body cream and see how your hands like it, before buying the hand cream.

It's so weird for something that thick to totally absorb into my skin like that, but it does. It helps so much with moisture and hydration! My skin loves this stuff! It has a very light scent nothing obnoxious or over bearing, like other high end brands. It's made of 25% shea butter, which is probably why it works so well. It's a pretty big container as well, it has 6.9 oz by weight. Which will last me a few months at least. I will say this is probably best as a winter body cream because of how thick and moisturizing it is but if you have super dry skin you could probably use it all year long. My skin is more dry on my body especially in the winter so a product like this has been perfect for me.  I haven't looked at how much this costs partly because I do like it so much I don't want the price tag to ruin that lol but even if it does have a higher price I still recommend this, it makes my skin feel like velvet
